title: Psychological morbidity among informal caregivers of older people: a 2-year follow-up study
authors: THE RESOURCE IMPLICATIONS STUDY GROUP OF THE MRC STUDY OF COGNITIVE FUNCTION AND AGEING (RIS MRC CFAS)
abstract: Mental frailty in care-recipients was not associated with deterioration over time in caregivers' psychological well-being. Caregiver characteristics were stronger than those of care-recipients in predicting psychological morbidity at follow-up and in predicting deteriorating well-being over time.
